summary: This list outlines five primary methods for knowledge base construction, ranging from human-driven approaches like manual curation and crowd-sourcing to automated techniques including information extraction and machine learning.
key_points: Knowledge bases can be built through expert manual curation or collaborative crowd-sourcing
Automated methods include extracting information from unstructured text and applying machine learning
Integration of existing structured data sources represents a hybrid approach
The methods range from fully human-dependent to increasingly automated approaches
Each method has different implications for accuracy, scalability, and resource requirements
